html:
Updates

** E-commerce and cloud service provider's shares AMZN.O up 11.3% at $3,090.91, set for their best day in over four years

** AMZN on track to add nearly $160 bln to its market cap

** AMZN on Thursday reported a 40% surge in rev from its cloud division, Amazon Web Services, to an est-beating $17.8 bln

** Brokerage Wedbush calls AWS growth "jaw-dropping", says it will be front and center for the Street this morning

** AWS led the cloud infrastructure services market in Q4 2021, accounting for 33% of total spend - Canalys

** Co's net income nearly doubled to $14.32 bln y/y, which included a pre-tax gain of $11.8 bln from its stake in EV maker Rivian Automotive RIVN.O (Full Story)

** AMZN also hiked its U.S. Prime subscription prices

** 54 of 55 brokerages rate the stock "buy" or higher, 1 "hold"; their median PT is $4,055

** Up to last close, stock fell ~11% in the past 12 months


(Reporting by Akash Sriram in Bengaluru)

(( Akash.Sriram@thomsonreuters.com ;))
